dt: {bc}seizure and detention of the goods of another as pledge {dx_def}see {dxt|pledge:1||1}{/dx_def} or to obtain satisfaction of a claim by the sale of the goods seized
{bc}pain or suffering affecting the body, a bodily part, or the mind {bc}{sx|trouble||}

dt.t: The patient showed no obvious signs of {wi}distress{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a state of danger or desperate need

pt: {sc}distress{/sc} {sc}suffering{/sc} {sc}misery{/sc} {sc}agony{/sc} mean the state of being in great trouble. {sc}distress{/sc} implies an external and usually temporary cause of great physical or mental strain and stress.

pt.t: the hurricane put everyone in great {it}distress{/it}

pt: {sc}suffering{/sc} implies conscious endurance of pain or distress.
{sc}misery{/sc} stresses the unhappiness attending especially sickness, poverty, or loss.

pt.t: the homeless live with {it}misery{/it} every day

pt: {sc}agony{/sc} suggests pain too intense to be borne.

pt.t: in {it}agony{/it} over the death of their child

et: Middle English {it}destresse{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}destresce{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*districtia{/it}, from Latin {it}districtus{/it}, past participle of {it}distringere{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|distrain||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: seizure and detention of the goods of another as pledge or to obtain satisfaction of a claim by the sale of the goods seized
pain or suffering affecting the body, a bodily part, or the mind : trouble

dt: {bc}to subject to great strain or difficulties
{bc}to force or overcome by inflicting pain
{bc}to cause to worry or be troubled {bc}{sx|upset||}
{bc}to mar (something, such as clothing or wood) deliberately to give an effect of age

shortdef: to subject to great strain or difficulties
to force or overcome by inflicting pain
to cause to worry or be troubled : upset
offered for sale at a loss

dt.t: The Coast Guard responded to the ship's {it}distress signal/call{/it}.

shortdef: a signal or call for help

dt: {bc}a message that one is in danger

dt.t: The pilot sent out a {it}distress signal{/it} before the plane crashed.

shortdef: a message that one is in danger

dt: {bc}respiratory failure of sudden onset in adults or children that follows injury to the endothelium of the lung (as in {d_link|sepsis|sepsis}, chest trauma, massive blood transfusion, {d_link|aspiration|aspiration} of the gastric contents, or pneumonia) and results in the accumulation of protein-rich fluid and the collapse of {d_link|alveoli|alveolus} leading to difficult, rapid breathing and very low levels of oxygen in the blood

shortdef: respiratory failure of sudden onset in adults or children that follows injury to the endothelium of the lung (as in sepsis, chest trauma, massive blood transfusion, aspiration of the gastric contents, or pneumonia) and results in the accumulation of protein-rich fluid and the collapse of alveoli leading to difficult, rapid breathing and very low levels of oxygen in the blood —abbreviation ARD—called also adult respiratory distress syndrome

dt: {bc}a respiratory disorder chiefly of newborn premature infants that is characterized by deficiency of the surfactant coating the inner surface of the lungs resulting in labored breathing, lung collapse, and hypoxemia {dx}compare {dxt|acute respiratory distress syndrome||}{/dx}

shortdef: a respiratory disorder chiefly of newborn premature infants that is characterized by deficiency of the surfactant coating the inner surface of the lungs resulting in labored breathing, lung collapse, and hypoxemia

dt.t: He was clearly {it}in distress{/it} upon hearing the news.

dt: {bc}in a very difficult situation in which one does not have enough money, food, etc.

dt.t: She's chosen to devote her life to helping those {it}in distress{/it}.

dt: {bc}in a state of danger or desperate need

shortdef: in a very difficult situation in which one does not have enough money, food, etc.
in a state of danger or desperate need
